snippet: As Russia faced a currency crisis that prompted bickering among some top presidential allies, consumers afraid of losing their savings flooded stores, rushing to dump rubles.
abstract: Russia is confronted with worsening currency crisis as ruble slides, with fearful consumers crowding stores to trade currency for durable goods; Pres Vladimir V Putin wrangles with situation, which was driven by sharp decline in price of oil; analysts say financial disaster could come quickly if global markets lose confidence in country's ability to control damage.

byline.original: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR and ANDREW E. KRAMER
byline.contributor: Andrew Roth, Alexandra Odynova and Sophia Kishkovsky contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: As Russia faced a currency crisis that prompted bickering among some top presidential allies, consumers afraid of losing their savings flooded stores, rushing to dump rubles.

headline.main: As the Ruble Swoons, Russians Desperately Shop
headline.print_headline: As the Ruble Swoons, Russians Desperately Shop
